title: Subscribe to a YouTube channel via email
text:
If you want to Subscribe to a YouTube channel but do not want to follow them.The trick is figuring out how to subscribe to a YouTube channel via email

Step 1: open youtube page of the channel want to subscribe
for example:https://www.youtube.com/@thecoatlessprofessor7674/videos


Step 2: view page source



Step 3: find ‘videos.xml’ in page source
for example: https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=UColncDCZ8SmTAHYr92QFclQ


Step 4: Use an RSS-to-Email Tool to Subscribe
using https://feedrabbit.com/ and enter your email address to subscribe.When there is a new video you will get a email.



Reference
https://greggblanchard.com/how-to-subscribe-to-a-youtube-channel-via-email/

title: Version control with renv
text:
The renv package helps you create reproducible environments for your R projects
# renv for R

title: Version control with renv
section: inital renv and create renv.lock with current loaded pacakge
text:
inital renv and create renv.lock with current loaded pacakge

renv::init()

title: Version control with renv
text:
show all installed pacakge

installed_pacakge = as.data.frame(installed.packages()[,c(1,3:4)])
installed_pacakge = installed_pacakge[is.na(installed_pacakge$Priority),1:2,drop=FALSE]
installed_pacakge

title: Version control with renv
section: show all installed pacakge and uploaded pacakge
text:
show all installed pacakge and uploaded pacakge

library(dplyr)
installed_pacakge = as.data.frame(installed.packages()[,c(1,3:4)])
installed_pacakge = installed_pacakge[is.na(installed_pacakge$Priority),1:2,drop=FALSE]
installed_pacakge |> filter(Package %in% (.packages()))

title: Version control with renv
section: when using renv and install new pakcage
text:
when using renv and install new pakcage

# it will not work
# library(lubridate)

title: Version control with renv
text:
install new package with renv::install

renv::install('lubridate')


library(lubridate)

title: Version control with renv
section: check current package and renv package
text:
check current package and renv package

renv::status()

title: Version control with renv
text:
update lock file

renv::snapshot()

title: Version control with renv
text:
check status again

renv::status()

title: Version control with renv
section: make all current pakcage version back to renv list
text:
make all current pakcage version back to renv list

renv::restore()

title: Version control with renv
section: update all pakcage in renv. recommand do it once a year to keep package updated.
text:
update all pakcage in renv. recommand do it once a year to keep package updated.

renv::update()

title: Version control with renv
text:
update renv itself only

renv::upgrade()

title: Version control with renv
text:
close renv in a project

renv::deactivate()

title: Version control with renv
section: re enable renv in a project
text:
re enable renv in a project

renv::activate()

title: Version control with renv
text:
set python version

renv::use_python()

title: Version control with renv
text:
check python version in renv

from sys import version as python_formatted_version
print(python_formatted_version)

title: Version control with renv
section: list all installed pacakge in python
text:
list all installed pacakge in python

import os
print(os.system('pip freeze'))

title: Version control with renv
text:
install package

import os
os.system('python3.10 -m pip install siuba')

title: Version control with renv
text:
update lock file

renv::snapshot()

title: Version control with renv
text:
uninstall package

import os
os.system('yes | python3.10 -m pip uninstall siuba')

title: Version control with renv
section: make all current pakcage version back to renv list
text:
make all current pakcage version back to renv list

renv::restore()

title: Version control with renv
text:
install package

import os
os.system('python3.10 -m pip install requests')

title: Version control with renv
text:
update lock file

renv::snapshot()
